result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas J. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit a DNA sample to the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs have been paid from defendant's bond.

The jail sentence shall begin no later than May 14, 2017 at 4:30 pm.  The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Taylor County Case 16CM62.
Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim and it shall be preapproved by the victim/witness coordinator.  This has been done.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas J. Allen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Douglas J. Allen in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Attorney Tlusty moves to dismiss the domestic abuse enhancer on count 1. Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Court dismisses and read read in Counts 2 and 3.  Statement by Attorney Nocco.   Court orders 20 days county jail with huber consecutive to 16CM62 -  sentence to begin no later than May 14, 2017 at 4:30 pm; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to victim preapproved by the victim witness coordinator.  This has been done.  4 days sentence credit.  The costs are to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning March 17, 2017.  - rt

Defendant Douglas J. Allen in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nocco states that no motions to be heard and agreement has been reached.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2017 at 02:15 pm. ba
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 14, 2017 at 02:15 pm.
Motion hearing on December 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas J. Allen in court with attorney Nocco appearing specially.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant contacted public defender's office and is eligible for public defender.  Attorney Nocco waives the reading of the complaint, charges and penalties.  Attorney Nocco enters a plea of not guilty on all charges.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Douglas J. Allen appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests $500.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Attorney Tlusty indicates to court that defendant has criminal charges in 16CM62 and another new charge that has not been filed yet.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders $500.00 cash bond; booking and no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is August 23, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
